HTML stands for HyperText Markup Language. It is used to design web pages using a markup language. HTML is the combination of Hypertext and Markup language. Hypertext defines the link between the web pages. A markup language is used to define the text document within tag which defines the structure of web pages. This language is used to annotate (make notes for the computer) text so that a machine can understand it and manipulate text accordingly. Most markup languages (e.g. HTML) are human-readable. The language uses tags to define what manipulation has to be done on the text. 
 HTML is a markup language used by the browser to manipulate text, images, and other content, in order to display it in the required format. HTML was created by Tim Berners-Lee in 1991. The first-ever version of HTML was HTML 1.0, but the first standard version was HTML 2.0, published in 1999. 
 Elements and Tags: HTML uses predefined tags and elements which tell the browser how to properly display the content. Remember to include closing tags. If omitted, the browser applies the effect of the opening tag until the end of the page. 
 HTML page structure: The basic structure of an HTML page is laid out below. It contains the essential building-block elements (i.e. doctype declaration, HTML, head, title, and body elements) upon which all web pages are created. 
 <DOCTYPE! html>: This is the document type declaration (not technically a tag). It declares a document as being an HTML document. The doctype declaration is not case-sensitive.
 <html>: This is called the HTML root element. All other elements are contained within it.
 <head>: The head tag contains the “behind the scenes” elements for a webpage. Elements within the head aren’t visible on the front-end of a webpage. HTML elements used inside the <head> element include: 
 <style>
 <title>
 <base>
 <noscript>
 <script>
 <meta>
 <link> 
 <body>: the body tag is used to enclose all the visible content of a webpage. In other words, the body content is what the browser will show on the front-end. 
 An HTML document can be created using any text editor. Save the text file using .html or .htm. Once saved as an HTML document, the file can be opened as a webpage in the browser. 
 NOTE: Basic/built-in text editors are Notepad (Windows) and TextEdit (Macs). Basic text editors are entirely sufficient for when you’re just getting started. As you progress, there are many feature-rich text editors available which allow for greater function and flexibility. 
 Features of HTML: 
 It is easy to learn and easy to use. 
 It is platform-independent.
 Images, videos, and audio can be added to a web page.
 Hypertext can be added to text.
 It is a markup language. 
 Why learn HTML? 
 It is a simple markup language. Its implementation is easy.
 It is used to create a website.
 Helps in developing fundamentals about web programming.
 Boost professional career. 
 Advantages: 
 HTML is used to build websites.
 It is supported by all browsers.
 It can be integrated with other languages like CSS, JavaScript, etc. 
 Disadvantages: 
 HTML can only create static webpages. For dynamic webpages, other languages have to be used.
 A large amount of code has to be written to create a simple web page.
 The security feature is not good.

Introduction to HTML5 Elements 

 We are mostly aware of web sites. A web site is simply a collection of web pages. For creating any web page we require. An HTML is the element that is responsible for making any web page. HTML stands for HyperText Markup Language. It is a basic markup language used to make any web pages that further comprise to form websites. HTML had evolved so much from the initial stage when it was formed
 
 W3C and WHATWG initially developed HTML. It was initially developed in 1993. W3C mainly checks for standards of Html and other stuff. HTML has evolved a lot from the initial version of 1.0 to the version of 5 HTML5 has lots of new HTML tags.
 HTML tags, their Uses and Examples
 
 Below are some tags of HTML with their uses, and examples. 

 New elements in HTML5

1)<datalist> – It is a new form element in HTML5 . It helps to implement a feature of autocomplete where an input box appears where the user can insert text to see elements in the list.

<output> – This tag represents the output of any calculation which is computed on an HTML file.

2) <input type=” text”> – This element is used to receive input from the user. The text entered by the user is generally text form.

3) <input type=” password”> – This element is used to receive a password from the user.

4) <input type=” submit”> – This tag renders a submit button. This button is used to submit the form.

5) <input type=” radio”> – This element helps to receive one input from the user from the available multiple items. User can select any of the items available in the list.

6) <input type=” checkbox”> – This element helps to receive multiple inputs from the user from the available multiple items. User can select any number of the items available in the list.

7) HTMLput type=” number”> – This element helps to numeric value from the user. User can insert an only numeric value into the field.

8) <input type=” email”> – This element helps to validate whether the value inserted by the user is a valid email. It shows an error on submit if the email is not valid.
 
 Apart from this, HTML5 has lots of new elements added to it. Some of them are –

• range
 • URL
 • tel
 • audio
 • embed
 
 Apart from HTML elements. It has also added new semantic elements. Some of the important semantic elements are-

• <article>
 • <figcaption>
 • <footer>
 • <section>
 • <mark>
 • <figure>
 • <aside>
 • <main>
 • <nav>
 • <details>
 • <header>

Javascript 
 
 Javascript is a client-side scripting language. Brendan Eich created JavaScript in September 1995. Javascript is created to make web pages alive. Javascript is most commonly used as a part of the web page. It is a programming language that adds interactivity to your website. In other words javascript help to make web pages interactive. It helps to add many animations, Dropdown Menus, and also help to make our website responsive.
 
 JavaScript enables interactivity on websites and gives them a sense of state. Javascript also helps to make dynamic pages. It also used to change the Html content and Html attributes value.

 Why javaScript Important?

The question is can we build our websites without javascript? And the answer is yes you don't need JavaScript to build a website. Javascript help to make web pages interactive. It helps to add different animations, many mouse events, create dropdowns, and help to make the website responsive..HTML is the content on the page the words, buttons, images. While CSS determines things like color, font size, positions of elements, align-items, and many others. A website is HTML, CSS, and not JavaScript. So where does JavaScript comes in, and why is it so important to develop websites? JavaScript adds interactivity to websites and gives them a sense of state. Javascript allows making dynamic pages.

 How to write Javascript:

There are two different ways to add javascript code to Html web page.

• Internal Javascript
 • External Javascript


Internal javascript

In this way you can write javascript code inside <script></script> tag. Javascript code is also called script. You can add more than one scripts to a web page.

You can place javacript code in both <head> section and also in <body> section. But <body> section is most preferred way to place script but you can also add script in the </head> section of html page.


External javascript

External javascript is the most preferred way to write javascript code. To add external javascript create a separate file with the extension of .js and after that to use this file on an HTML page write the complete path of the javascript file in the “src” attribute of <script> tag.

Create separate file with “.js” extension :

After that include this file to html page:

Javascript course outline

Here are the important things you should learn about javascript as a beginner to start web development:

• How to write Javascript code

• -> Javascript Variable

• -> Built-in methods in Javascript

• -> String Methods

• -> Javascript Math methods

• -> Date and Time

• -> Javascript Operators

• -> Conditional statements

• -> Javascript Loops

• -> Javascript Arrays

• Functions

• Javascript Objects

• Dom Manipulation

• Javascript Events
 
 This is all about from this JavaScript tutorial we discuss complete introduction to javaScript. We also discuss the complete course outline of JavaScript. Learn more about JavaScript.
